stimulusHtml:
The following questions refer to this passage:

"Cui placeas, inquire tamen; non incola montis,

non ego sum pastor, non hic armenta gregesque

horridus observo. Nescis, temeraria, nescis

quem fugias, ideoque fugis. Mihi Delphica tellus

(5) et Claros et Tenedos Patareaque regia servit;

Iuppiter est genitor; per me quod eritque fuitque

estque patet; per me concordant carmina nervis."

In the passage above, the speaker is describing himself to a potential lover. In a short essay, discuss the ways in which the speaker reveals his identity and personality through his words. You may wish to consider such elements as word choice, word placement, and figures of speech in your discussion. Refer specifically to the Latin to support your answer.
